required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Molecular Taxonomy of Surgically-harvested Ocular Tissues Defined by Single-cell Transcriptomics
clinical_study.official_title: Molecular Taxonomy of Surgically-harvested Ocular Tissues Defined by Single-cell Transcriptomics

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The surgically-harvested eye tissue (ie. vitreous-retinal proliferative membrane, outflow pathway, retinas, and pterygium) is a complex tissue responsible for maintaining intraocular homeostasis or mediating ocular pathogenesis. Dysfunction of one or more resident cell types within the tissues results in different ocular disorder, leading to vision loss, or even blindness. In this study, we aim to use single-cell RNA sequencing to generate a comprehensive cell atlas of surgically-harvested eye tissues.

primary_outcome.description: single-cell sequencing identify what cells and the counts within the eye tissue

intervention.description: surgery to remove the pathological eye tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with ocular diseases and require surgery intervention.
2. The surgery intervention remove pathological tissue during surgery.
3. Patients consent to the treatment and single-cell sequencing.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Surgically removed eye tissue cannot meet with the quality control of single-cell sequencing (mainly the tissue weight and cell counts);

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University
